columns.text: In this problem, we will identify the reason why a company has bonds for several different companies.

Bonds are a way for a company to borrow money from other companies in order to raise capital on an investment or to simply cover operational costs.

Despite Chevron (CVX) being one of the largest companies in the oil business, they still have bonds from other companies. One primary reason for this is that there is a high rate of corporate tax that the company is trying to avoid. In order to avoid paying large amounts for taxes, they buy bonds from other companies that are located in areas with lower corporate tax which allows them to pay lower taxes.

Aside from this, they can also use these bonds to issue stock and pay dividends to their shareholders. In doing so, they maintain their revenue which they can reinvest in research and development rather than using it all to pay for their investor's dividends.

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
